title: Rocco Forte Hotels makes two new appointments
text:
Rocco Forte Hotels makes two new appointments Rocco Forte Hotels makes two new appointments Details Category: Appointments Created   10:00 The hotel group Rocco Forte Hotels, the family of ten hotels across Europe, has appointed a new Director of Global Sales and C&I and Entertainment Global Sales Manager in their London head office. These appointments come after the launch of Rocco Forte Hotels new events programme, Rocco Forte Events. This newly developed offering for meetings, conferences, events, and incentives, creates a consistent events product across the hotels, with the Silver, Gold and Platinum packages. 
Each of these packages are personalised and tailored to clients’ individual requirements with tiered benefits for meeting planners, as well as unique offerings for delegates throughout their stay, with a strong focus on food. ￼ Claire Mahon has been appointed Global Sales Manager for C&I and Entertainment. With five years of experience in hospitality behind her, Clare joined the team from Jumeirah, where she was responsible for the meeting and groups sales of the two London hotels. In her new role at Rocco Forte Hotels, Clare will be responsible for looking after the key C&I accounts globally, in addition to entertainment clients, reporting to Richard Bousfield, Director of Global Sales for Europe and the Middle East. Kos Kaklidakis joins the Rocco Forte team as Director of Global Sales, overseeing the sales efforts in terms of C&I and Entertainment for the London office as well as high rated transient business from Film, Music and Media companies. He will be working together with Claire Mahon, and reporting to Richard Bousfield. Before starting at Rocco Forte Hotels, Kos was Acting Director of Sales Worldwide at Maybourne Hotel Group, where he managed top corporate accounts and launched the Maybourne Roadshows Partners programme.
